episodeTitle: Are You Happy? The Doctor Who is Called a Witch!
description: While Luffy and Sanji struggle through the wilderness carrying the sick Nami, Wapol returns to Drum Island with his crew, threatening the peace. The islanders learn that the doctor they seek is on the opposite side of the island, prompting a desperate journey. Chopper makes his first appearance alongside Dr. Kureha.

events.title: Tony Tony Chopper's First Appearance
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper, a reindeer who ate the Hito Hito no Mi, makes his first appearance in the series. He is seen with Dr. Kureha as they travel through the snowy landscape of Drum Island.
events.significance: This is the debut of the future doctor of the Straw Hat Pirates and the first glimpse of a character who will become a beloved crew member. Chopper's introduction sets up his eventual recruitment arc.

events.title: Dr. Kureha Treats Sick Boy
events.description: Dr. Kureha performs a medical procedure on a sick boy in a village, demonstrating her exceptional medical skills. After treating him with surgery and antibiotics, she demands an unusual payment: food, beverages, trash bags, and 50% of the restaurant's assets.
events.significance: This scene establishes Dr. Kureha's character as an eccentric but highly skilled doctor, showcasing why she is known as the witch doctor of Drum Island. It demonstrates her unorthodox methods and personality.

quotes.text: My fee is food, beverages, trash bags, and 50% of this restaurant's assets!
quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha
quotes.context: Demanding payment for treating the sick boy

events.title: Tamachibi's First Appearance
events.description: Tamachibi, one of Wapol's subordinates, makes his first appearance as part of the Bliking Pirates crew arriving at Drum Island.
events.significance: Introduces another member of Wapol's forces who will participate in the conflict for control of Drum Island.

events.title: Robson's First Appearance
events.description: Robson, Wapol's giant hippo mount, makes his first appearance. Wapol is seen riding on Robson as the Bliking Pirates arrive at Drum Island.
events.significance: Introduces Wapol's primary mode of transportation and a creature that serves as part of his combat capabilities.

events.title: Wapol Returns to Drum Island
events.description: The Bliking Pirates, led by former king Wapol, arrive at the coast of Drum Island. Wapol has returned to reclaim his kingdom after previously fleeing when Blackbeard attacked. His arrival strikes fear into the hearts of the islanders.
events.significance: This marks a major turning point in the Drum Island arc. Wapol's return represents the threat of tyranny returning to the island and sets up the main conflict of the arc.

events.title: Dalton Informed of Wapol's Return
events.description: A badly injured watchman informs Dalton that Wapol has returned to Drum Island. Dalton, who had been helping Usopp and Vivi search for the doctor, immediately recognizes the grave threat this poses to the island.
events.significance: This moment reveals the deep fear and trauma associated with Wapol's rule and shows Dalton's protective nature toward the island he now guards. It forces Dalton to choose between helping the Straw Hats and protecting his people.

events.title: Dalton Returns to Face Wapol
events.description: Upon hearing of Wapol's return, Dalton makes the difficult decision to abandon the search for the doctor and return to the village to confront his former king and protect the islanders from tyranny.
events.significance: Demonstrates Dalton's character development and his commitment to protecting Drum Island's citizens, even at the cost of not helping the Straw Hats find the doctor for Nami.

events.title: Luffy and Sanji Encounter the Lapahns
events.description: While climbing the Drum Rockies to reach the doctor, Luffy and Sanji encounter a herd of Lapahns - giant, ferocious carnivorous rabbits. Sanji warns Luffy not to attack or be struck by the animals because Nami, who is strapped to Luffy's back, would receive the impact.
events.significance: This creates a challenging combat scenario where Luffy cannot fight normally due to carrying the sick Nami. It demonstrates the danger of Drum Island's wildlife and the crew's dedication to protecting their nakama.

quotes.text: Don't attack them and don't let them hit you! Nami will take the damage too!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Warning Luffy about fighting while carrying Nami

events.title: Lapahn-Triggered Avalanche
events.description: The herd of Lapahns intentionally triggers a massive avalanche to stop Luffy and Sanji. The two Straw Hats find themselves caught in the middle of the deadly snow cascade while trying to protect the unconscious Nami.
events.significance: This creates a life-threatening situation that demonstrates the harsh and dangerous nature of Drum Island's environment. It shows the intelligence and threat level of the Lapahns as creatures.

events.title: Zoro Encounters Kureha and Chopper
events.description: Zoro, who has gotten lost while wandering in the woods, encounters Dr. Kureha and Chopper. He asks for a ride to the next village but Kureha kicks him in the face for calling her old, then leaves.
events.significance: This is Zoro's first encounter with the mysterious doctor the crew has been searching for, and his first meeting with Chopper, though he doesn't yet realize their significance. It also establishes Kureha's sensitive nature about her age.

quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha
quotes.context: Before kicking Zoro for calling her old

events.title: Doctor's Location Revealed
events.description: The islanders inform Usopp and Vivi that the doctor they seek is on the other side of Drum Island, requiring a difficult journey across treacherous terrain.
events.significance: This information complicates the Straw Hats' mission to save Nami and explains why Luffy and Sanji are making the dangerous climb up the Drum Rockies.

events.title: Dalton's Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Bison Devil Fruit Revealed
events.description: The episode reveals that Dalton possesses the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Bison, a Zoan-type Devil Fruit that allows him to transform into a bison or a human-bison hybrid. While the full transformation may not be shown in this episode, his Devil Fruit ability is established.
events.significance: This is the debut of the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Bison in the series. It establishes Dalton as a Devil Fruit user and shows that he has significant combat capabilities to defend Drum Island against Wapol.

quotes.text: My fee is food, beverages, trash bags, and 50% of this restaurant's assets!
quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha
quotes.context: Demanding payment for treating a sick boy

quotes.text: Don't attack them and don't let them hit you! Nami will take the damage too!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Warning Luffy about the Lapahns while carrying Nami

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes the crew's unwavering dedication to saving Nami, with Luffy and Sanji risking their lives climbing through dangerous terrain and facing deadly wildlife.
themes.symbolism: The harsh winter landscape and treacherous climb represent the obstacles the crew is willing to overcome for their nakama.

themes.description: Wapol's return to Drum Island represents the fear of past oppression coming back and threatens the fragile peace the islanders have found.
themes.symbolism: Wapol arriving on his ship symbolizes the return of dark times for Drum Island's citizens.

themes.description: Dr. Kureha's unusual methods and payment demands introduce the theme of unconventional but effective medical practice.
themes.symbolism: Being called a 'witch' represents society's fear and misunderstanding of those who are different, even when they help others.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper makes his debut in the series, appearing briefly with Dr. Kureha. While his character is not yet developed in this episode, his presence is established.
Demonstrates his absolute commitment to saving his crew members by continuing to climb the mountain despite overwhelming obstacles.
keyActions: Carries sick Nami on his back up the mountain
Faces the Lapahns without being able to fight normally
Survives the avalanche while protecting Nami

characterSpotlights.development: Establishes her character as an eccentric but highly skilled doctor with unusual payment methods and a fierce personality.
keyActions: Treats sick boy with surgery and antibiotics
Demands unusual payment from the restaurant
Kicks Zoro for calling her old
Travels with Chopper through the wilderness
quotes: My fee is food, beverages, trash bags, and 50% of this restaurant's assets!

characterSpotlights.development: Returns to Drum Island seeking to reclaim his throne, re-establishing himself as a primary antagonist for this arc.
keyActions: Arrives at Drum Island with the Bliking Pirates
Threatens the peace of the island

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his commitment to protecting Drum Island by choosing to confront Wapol rather than continue helping find the doctor.
keyActions: Makes the decision to return to face his former king
Abandons the search for the doctor to protect the villagers

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his tactical thinking and care for Nami by warning Luffy about the consequences of fighting while carrying her.
keyActions: Accompanies Luffy on the dangerous climb
Helps protect Nami during the avalanche
quotes: Don't attack them and don't let them hit you! Nami will take the damage too!

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode adapts portions of both Chapter 134 (pages 12-19) and Chapter 135 (pages 2-19), combining content from two chapters into a single episode.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final use of the ending theme 'Shōchi no suke' by Suitei Shōjo, which had been used since Episode 73.
Tony Tony Chopper is voiced by Ikue Otani in Japanese, who is also famous for voicing Pikachu in the Pokémon anime series.

sources.title: Tony Tony Chopper - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode had a TV rating of 15.5% in Japan, ranking 5th in viewership for its timeslot.
The Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Bison makes its debut in this episode as Dalton's Devil Fruit power, making it the first Ushi Ushi fruit shown in the series.

sources.title: Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Bison - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Lapahns are giant carnivorous rabbits native to Drum Island that are intelligent enough to strategically cause avalanches to eliminate threats.

sources.title: Who is Lapahn in One Piece? - Sportskeeda Wiki
